subs.text: 1/ A question for any datacrunchers among my followers. I have a CSV file with roughly 1000 rows and 100 column. Each row is one response to a hundred questions open ended survey. What is your favorite kosher restaurant? What is your favorite Jewish organization? Etc.
subs.rawText: 1/ A question for any datacrunchers among my followers. I have a CSV file with roughly 1000 rows and 100 column. Each row is one response to a hundred questions open ended survey. What is your favorite kosher restaurant? What is your favorite Jewish organization? Etc.

subs.text: 2/ For each column, I’d like to generate a sorted table of the most popular non-NULL answers, along with how many responses that answer got.
subs.rawText: 2/ For each column, I’d like to generate a sorted table of the most popular non-NULL answers, along with how many responses that answer got.

subs.text: 3/ I would like to separately see a list of all unique entries, so I can massage the data to eliminate misspellings and the like so all entries reading “TA Pizza” in column five can be changed to “Tel Aviv Pizza.”
subs.rawText: 3/ I would like to separately see a list of all unique entries, so I can massage the data to eliminate misspellings and the like so all entries reading “TA Pizza” in column five can be changed to “Tel Aviv Pizza.”

subs.text: @roeiwrites 2) Wertheimer was a top JTS official when it collapsed, along with Consetvative synagogue affiliation. This was in part because American Jews had dropped old models of Judaism (of which intermarriage is one symptom) but also because of structural and institutional failures.

subs.text: @roeiwrites To my knowledge, the only response Wertheimer offered was to lament that Jews no longer felt a sense of “obligation.”
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites To my knowledge, the only response Wertheimer offered was to lament that Jews no longer felt a sense of “obligation.”

subs.text: @roeiwrites At no time did he utilize scholarly models of religion or theology or sociology to figure out what was going on. He stuck with the pre-modern notion that if we just preach harder, people will change their ways.

subs.text: @roeiwrites (The fact that that model didn’t work for Isaiah or Jeremiah or the Hatam Sofer seems to have escaped him.)

subs.text: @roeiwrites His insistence on seeing American Judaism through traditional categories was a profound epistemological mistake with real communal and institutional consequences.
